channel.title: Attempt at a character
channel.description:
So my friend Mikkel and I decided to move away from Runescape Private servers. This, in turn, lead to us deciding to work on making our own game. After a few days of having a 2d game from scratch we decided to move onto 3d. Mikkel then suggested I attempt to make models so I thought I'd post here for some feedback. :D
I spent a bit on this as my first attempt to make a character's head. [IMG]http://i470.photobucket.com/albums/rr64/Scullyscape/characterheadforvenatus.png[/img] Any and all criticism would be great, anything I can improve. I'd prefer not have comments just saying how horrible it is. [IMG]http://i470.photobucket.com/albums/rr64/Scullyscape/characterbodyforvenatus.png[/img]

item.title: Attempt at a character
item.dc:creator: @iScape0 iScape0
item.description:
@iScape0 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:12, topic:333106”]THEIR client, or cache. And your calling me an idiot, when you don’t even know what hosting means.

Hosting = webclient.

Or, if you don’t use their cache your fine…[/quote]

How is that talking about Models???

Read full topic

item.title: Attempt at a character
item.dc:creator: @Scully Scully
item.description:
@Scully wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:10, topic:333106”][quote author=Scully link=topic=429522.msg3153902#msg3153902 date=1268820420]

This “project” of your won’t succeed knowing the fact you release every thing you touch, when you dishonor someone’s hard work on it (project Annihilation 459).

@Model The shape of his head is too, round.

Mikkel said release, so GTFO. Besides who the hell cares it’s a Runescape private server. Note that everything about running one and making any profit is illegal so have fun with that.
[/quote]

No its not. Hosting there client is or using their cache illegal[/quote]
You’re a damn fool that’s what I mean who the fuck would just run a server and not have a client to connect. Use your damn brain, boy.
If this goes as planned, which it probably won’t, we could at least make some money legally.

Read full topic

item.title: Attempt at a character
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Reminds me of CB Model Pro:
LINK: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GgnmxyASr70
Heh, its prolly not, but just at how its shaped it does. The program hasnt been updated for a few years.

Not bad though, alot of people wouldnt attempt this much ‘detail’ for a game, but would just get the base-shape of it all and throw down a texture. I must say, GL, and i cant wait to test it.

Read full topic

item.title: Attempt at a character
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

thats quite a good attempt at a head, all it needs now is a few details added, and then yeah, your good.

i defentally think you have a chance in the modeling world, you just need to practice

Read full topic

item.title: Attempt at a character
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

3D & Motion Graphics Envato Tuts+

Character Modeling in Blender

Character modeling can be a daunting field to get into. Developing a solid character with good design and proper topology takes a lot of work. This tutorial provides an introduction to the many...

Read full topic
